title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment likely today: How to check status online via registrar, NSE & BSE; Check latest GMP
author: Moneycontrol News
content:
Bharat Coking Coal IPO share allotment is likely to be finalised later tonight, January 14, after the issue drew an investor demand of a whopping 147 times in the primary market.

The Rs 1,071-croreBharat Coking CoalIPO was open for subscription from January 9-13. The company had fixed the price band at Rs 21-23 per share.

IPO applicants can check their Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment status on the official website of the registrar, KFin Technologies Limited, by entering their application number or PAN. The status will also be available on the BSE and NSE websites.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment date today: Steps to check share allotment status on KFin Tech

Step 1: Open the direct link to the registrar on this URL (https://ipostatus.kfintech.com/).

Step 2: Select the IPO from the dropdown menu.

Step 3: Investors can check the allotment status by filling in details like PAN, Application number or DP client ID.

Step 4: Press the Submit button

Step 5: The allotment status will be shown in the window.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment status check on NSE

Step 1:Open the website of NSE by clicking on this direct link (https://www.nseindia.com/products/dynaContent/equities/ipos/ipo_login.jsp).

Step 2:Select the company 'Bharat Coking Coal' by selecting Equity & SME IPO bid details

Step 3:Investors can check the allotment status by filling in details like their IPO Application number or PAN details after selecting company symbol.

Step 4:Press the Submit button

Step 5:The allotment status will be shown in the window.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment status check on direct link of BSE

Step 1:Open the website of BSE by clicking on this direct link (https://www.bseindia.com/investors/appli_check.aspx)

Step 2:Select Equity in the issue type.

Step 3:Fill in the required details including the 'Issue Name'.

Step 4:Enter PAN number and click on Search to view the status

Step 5:The allotment status will be shown in the window.

According to platforms tracking grey market activity, shares of Bharat Coking Coal are commanding a premium of 43-59 percent in the unregulated market. Investorgain quoted a GMP of Rs 13.6, indicating a potential listing gain of 59.13 percent, while IPO Watch pegged the premium at around 43.48 percent.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO shares will be listed on both NSE and BSE platforms onÂ January 19.
